title: Sub-optical-cycle manipulation of valley-polarized currents
authors:
Wenqing Li, Xiaosong Zhu, Liang Li, Wanzhu He, Jie Long, Pengfei Lan
  and Peixiang Lu
abstract:
Manipulating valley-polarized currents at optical frequencies is the key to
petahertz valleytronics, yet it remains intractable. To tackle this challenge,
we propose an all-optical scheme using non-resonant bichromatic optical fields,
which allow for the control of sub-cycle electron dynamics. The combined effect
of the helical and asymmetric waveforms of the optical fields leads to the
valley-polarization and displacement of the excited electrons concurrently,
thereby inducing the valleypolarized currents, on the sub-optical-cycle
timescale. This scheme inherently possesses remarkable resilience to
decoherence, making it particularly suitable for materials with short
decoherence times. Moreover, the direction of the currents can be precisely
controlled by adjusting the relative phase of the bichromatic components. Our
scheme offers a promising avenue for generating and modulating valley-polarized
currents at the femtosecond timescale, opening the door to the realm of
petahertz valleytronics.
